passage: Midway through her 1968 jazz album A Monastic Trio , Alice Coltrane switches instruments, swapping the piano for the harp. With the same fluid style that Coltrane was famous for on piano, she ______ blank her fingers across the harp strings and creates a radiant sound.
question_text: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

answer_rationales.D: Choice D is the best answer. The convention being tested is subject-verb agreement. The singular verb "sweeps" agrees in number with the singular subject "she," which refers to Alice Coltrane.
answer_rationales.A: Choice A is incorrect because the plural verb "sweep" doesn't agree in number with the singular subject "she."
answer_rationales.B: Choice B is incorrect because the plural verb "are sweeping" doesn't agree in number with the singular subject "she."
answer_rationales.C: Choice C is incorrect because the plural verb "were sweeping" doesn't agree in number with the singular subject "she."
